definition: (of a cadre etc) to work for a period of time with a grassroots unit to gain firsthand experience/(dialect) taking a crap

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Are there many birds around your neighbourhood?
sentences.chinese: 今天的蹲点人还是满多的哦。

sentences.english: By September over 100 moneylenders were showing up at his premises every day demanding repayment.
sentences.chinese: 但到了9月，每天都有将近100多人蹲点向他讨债。

sentences.english: C tells everyone that there's press outside the hospital waiting.
sentences.chinese: 告诉大家，媒体正在医院门口蹲点。

sentences.english: Each junior must at least be in your team for one season.
sentences.chinese: 每个青年球员必须最少在你的球队蹲点一赛季。

sentences.english: Almost exactly a month has past since I went off to work.
sentences.chinese: 从下去蹲点到今天，整整将近一个月了。

sentences.english: The county Party secretary has gone to stay in a village to gain firsthand experience.
sentences.chinese: 县委书记到一个乡村蹲点去了。

definition: to hang around keeping a watch out for sth
lit. to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits (idiom)/to wait idly for opportunities/to trust to chance rather than show initiative
to deploy surveillance/to put under surveillance
to make secret inquiries/to investigate in secret
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
open enquiries and secret search (idiom); to investigate openly and in secret/taking information from all sides
sudden unannounced investigation/on-the-spot inspection/to search without notification
(of a thief, smuggler etc) to be caught with stolen or illegal goods/to be caught red-handed
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
